e="preserve">Ruben Armand "Benny" Mardones (November 9, 1946 – June 29, 2020) was an American pop singer-songwriter. He was known for his hit single "Into the Night," which hit the Top 20 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 chart twice, in 1980 (#11) and again in 1989 (#20). He was born in Cleveland, Ohio.
Mardones died on June 29, 2020 at his home in Menifee, California from Parkinson's disease-related problems, aged 73.
